article.title: BOOK REVIEWS
article.abstract:
Book reviewed in this article:
Macroeconomic Theory and Policy. By William H. Branson.
Money and Banking. By John M. Culbertson.
Monetary and Fiscal Policy in a Growing Economy. By Duncan K. Foley and Miguel Sidrauski.
The Current Inflation. Edited by Harry G. Johnson and A. R. Nobay.
Investment: The Study of an Economic Aggregate. By Philip J. Lund.
Money Matters. By A. James Meigs.
The Business Cycle Today. Edited by Victor Zarnowitz.
Essays in the Theory of Risk‐Bearing. By Kenneth J. Arrow.
Capital Budgeting: The Public and Private Sectors. By A. James Boness.
The Repurchase of Common Stock. By Charles D. Ellis and Allen E. Young.
Investment and Portfolio Analysis. By Haim Levy and Marshall Sarnat.
Monetary Policy and the Federal Funds Market. By James M. Boughton.
Finance and Economic Development in the Old South: Louisiana Banking 1804–1861. By George D. Green.
Banking and Economic Development: Some Lessons of History. Edited by Rondo Cameron.
The Eurodollar. Edited by Herbert V. Prochnow.
Fiscal Federalism. By Wallace E. Oates.
